page.title: 03FARMING _ Arable and Dairy
page.content: {Dairy Farming on the Salisbury Estate At Park Dairy they have a herd of 140 Fresian milking cows. They are milked at 5.30am and 3pm and each cow produces four to five gallons of milk each day. It is stored in a cooled tank overnight. Collected daily by the milk_marketing board the milk is used for yogurt, butter and cream as well as being delivered to the door after treatment. {Arable Farming on the Salisbury Estate About 2,450 acres are used for growing crops and grazing cattle. Barley, wheat, oats, peas, evening primrose and oilseed rape are grown and grass is cut for hay and silage.Barley is sold to make beer, wheat is ground for biscuits and bread, oats for cereal. Evening primrose is used in medicines, peas are for cattle feed and oilseed rape is for margarine and cooking oil.
